templates.title: üß† Trading Psychology: The Fear of Missing Out (FOMO)
templates.core_idea: FOMO causes traders to enter late, emotionally, and without defined risk.
templates.description: FOMO is one of the fastest ways to damage or blow up a trading account. When price moves aggressively, early participants are taking profits while late traders are providing liquidity. Emotional entries lead to poor risk-reward and bad decision-making.
rules: Do not chase parabolic green candles
Wait for pullbacks, consolidations, or flags
Missed trades are better than bad trades
The market provides opportunities every day
templates.pro_insight: If a setup is real, it will offer multiple entries. If it doesn't, it wasn't your trade.
common_mistakes: Buying the top of extended moves
Ignoring stop losses due to excitement
Increasing size out of fear of missing profits

templates.title: üìâ Technical Analysis: Support & Resistance Flip
templates.core_idea: Previous resistance often becomes new support after a breakout.
templates.description: Support and resistance flips occur when price breaks above a key resistance level and then retraces to test that level. Buyers often defend this area, confirming the breakout and offering a safer entry.
steps: Price breaks above a well-defined resistance level
Buyers step in and hold the level
templates.pro_insight: Breakouts excite beginners. Retests reward professionals.

templates.title: üõ°Ô∏è Risk Management: The 1% Rule
templates.core_idea: Never risk more than 1‚Äì2% of total account equity on a single trade.
templates.description: Risk management is the foundation of long-term profitability. The 1% rule ensures that no single trade can significantly damage your account, allowing you to survive losing streaks and trade consistently.
rules: Position size is determined by stop-loss distance
No stop loss means no trade
templates.pro_insight: Survive first. Profit second. Compound always.

templates.title: üìä Volume Analysis: Confirming the Move
templates.core_idea: Volume confirms the strength and validity of price movements.
templates.description: Volume reveals participation and intent behind price action. Strong moves require strong volume. Weak volume often signals fakeouts or exhausted trends.

bearish: Volume divergence near highs or lows

rules: Always check volume before entering trades
Reduce size if volume confirmation is weak
High volume at extremes can signal reversals
templates.pro_insight: Volume is the lie detector of price action.

templates.title: üìà Trend Following: Golden Cross Watch
templates.core_idea: A Golden Cross signals long-term trend confirmation, not prediction.
templates.description: A Golden Cross occurs when the 50-day moving average crosses above the 200-day moving average. It is widely followed by institutions and often aligns with long-term bullish momentum.
conditions: Higher highs and higher lows present
templates.pro_insight: Do not predict trends. Follow them.
